sentences.english: He watched her as greedily as he had watched her in the playground.
sentences.chinese: 斯内普渴慕地望着她，就像游乐场上望着她时一样。

sentences.english: They admire those Olympic title-holders very much.
sentences.chinese: 他们十分渴慕那些奥运冠军们。

sentences.english: As the deer pantech for the water, So my soul longeth after thee.
sentences.chinese: 如同鹿切切渴慕溪水，我灵依渴追求你。

sentences.english: They hide in the shadows to sing, but by your desire for happiness transition.
sentences.chinese: 它们躲在暗处浅吟低唱，然而因着你对幸福过渡渴慕。

sentences.english: He made me thirst after His righteousness.
Whoever may be longing, salt is there to make him thirst for God's righteousness and God's Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 谁在空虚之中，盐就使他渴慕神的国和神的义。

sentences.english: The tree comes up to my window like the yearning voice of the dumb earth.
sentences.chinese: 树木伸到我的窗前，如瘖哑的大地发出渴慕的声音。

sentences.english: Has a kiss of desire on the lips.
The entire life of a good Christian is an exercise in holy desire.
sentences.chinese: 一位敬虔的基督徒，终其一生操练渴慕神。

definition: (third person pronoun for a divine being)
memorial tablet in a temple commemorating a deceased father
Abba (Aramaic word father)/by ext. God the Father in Christian gospel
to be enamored of/to have tender feelings for/to be sentimentally attached to (a person or place)
